commit_message:
imagebackend: Check that the RBD image exists before trying to cleanup

In volume-backed setups, there is no image to clean up, so any
attempts to cleanup the resize snapshots will fail by definition.
Make sure the image exists first.

NOTE(mriedem): The backport has to add an additional mock that wasn't
in the original change because on master the fake_imagebackend.Raw
object wasn't used, simply a mock.Mock object which handled the
check_image_exists() method call on the fake image backend.

Change-Id: I25f65bcc76b83f31a8fce77c2b751d2d167ffc7e
Closes-Bug: 1580625
(cherry picked from commit 671bb2651d9d1a07947690468825581d30482dcb)

subject: Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 15:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-mysql-replication-bf2b131994a5a772.yaml', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/mysql_gtid.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/replication_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/replication_runners.py'], 'message': "Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

A release note has been added.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication
because it mechanism is different.

Scenario tests were run succesfully on Mysql, Percona and
MariaDB with this change in place.

Change-Id: I66c8b6278afa50ba14e4bb7888e3a25dc657a9e4
Closes-bug: 1563574
(cherry picked from commit 09a312ae3af1958df6dadcfd68dfae7261971fa3)
"}]
commit_message:
Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

A release note has been added.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication
because it mechanism is different.

Scenario tests were run succesfully on Mysql, Percona and
MariaDB with this change in place.

Change-Id: I66c8b6278afa50ba14e4bb7888e3a25dc657a9e4
Closes-bug: 1563574
(cherry picked from commit 09a312ae3af1958df6dadcfd68dfae7261971fa3)

commit_message:
imagebackend: Check that the RBD image exists before trying to cleanup

In volume-backed setups, there is no image to clean up, so any
attempts to cleanup the resize snapshots will fail by definition.
Make sure the image exists first.

NOTE(mriedem): The test in the backport is slightly different from
mitaka because of some minor things with stubs and config options.

Change-Id: I25f65bcc76b83f31a8fce77c2b751d2d167ffc7e
Closes-Bug: 1580625
(cherry picked from commit 671bb2651d9d1a07947690468825581d30482dcb)
(cherry picked from commit 8b256fb50a0bb9c6ddcbff2099a744045688b652)

subject: Notification exceptions not sent back correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 21:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['trove/conductor/api.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_notification_err_msgs-e52771108633c9cf.yaml'], 'message': 'Notification exceptions not sent back correctly

With the new notification feature added recently, exceptions
that occur on the guest are sent back to the conductor.
Due to a mis-match in the code however, the wrong call is being
issued. The conductor api makes a call to notify_exception
instead of notify_exc_info.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ib2e04bb903c92b4d570913aba2e985db63c45096
Closes-Bug: #1577848
(cherry picked from commit 9f7be1a10b0a53c6d8bd783a714fac2864186600)
'}]
commit_message:
Notification exceptions not sent back correctly

With the new notification feature added recently, exceptions
that occur on the guest are sent back to the conductor.
Due to a mis-match in the code however, the wrong call is being
issued. The conductor api makes a call to notify_exception
instead of notify_exc_info.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ib2e04bb903c92b4d570913aba2e985db63c45096
Closes-Bug: #1577848
(cherry picked from commit 9f7be1a10b0a53c6d8bd783a714fac2864186600)

commit_message:
Enable viewing segments through API in ML2

This patch partially implements the segments extension in ML2.  It
allows viewing segments through the API but doesn't allow create,
update, or delete on them.  Since segments can currently be created
through the provider or multiprovider net extensions, this could be
useful to unblock other work around segments.

Change-Id: I88942328ab96a44d991e246c2818ab4994748726
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Add python-monascaclient to the global requirements

Now that Monasca is in the big tent we are collaborating with
other projects to get support and integration.

For this reason we need to be able to include the client in the
requirements of these projects.

that neutron-metadata-agent was the correct name for the metadata
proxy, but parts of the code were not consistent.

commit_message:
Create service project in service domain

When creating service users, the assumption is that the service
project lies within the service domain, so create it there.

Change-Id: I4880e789f5eaf340634ceb792397eef12a5a6b51
Closes-Bug: 1580998

subject: Do not remove root user on disable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 15:33:11.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py', 'releasenotes/notes/mysql-root-fix-35079552e25170ca.yaml', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py'], 'message': 'Do not remove root user on disable

The existence of the root user (with remote access)
is used to determine whether root was ever enabled on a restored
instance.
Do not remove it, just generate a new random password for it.

Change-Id: I8a4321ac062b1ec565945b49dbb7c619b6da867f
Closes-Bug: 1549600
(cherry picked from commit 52bc1ab9c89cdca7c2556edb373ce3b59ace0295)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not remove root user on disable

The existence of the root user (with remote access)
is used to determine whether root was ever enabled on a restored
instance.
Do not remove it, just generate a new random password for it.

Change-Id: I8a4321ac062b1ec565945b49dbb7c619b6da867f
Closes-Bug: 1549600
(cherry picked from commit 52bc1ab9c89cdca7c2556edb373ce3b59ace0295)

commit_message:
Switch values for cinder_report_interval and cinder_service_down_time

Values for cinder_report_interval and cinder_service_down_time are confused
and should be switched. cinder_report_interval should be 10 instead of 60, and
cinder_service_down_time should be 60 instead of 10.

Change-Id: Icb1404bbac89bd978296e4194a9f334874da05ca
Closes-Bug: #1568803
Related-Bug: #1572689
(cherry picked from commit 09c1f1f2144c32916b085c23dc3afd918783359b)

subject: Fix license in setup.py
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-12 20:51:28.000000000', 'files': ['setup.py'], 'message': 'Fix license in setup.py

While the ldappool project is MPL and the license info is appropriately
associated with Tarek, setup.py is actually not a file written by him -
it is an exact copy of the boilerplate OpenStack setup.py file which is
Apache licensed. There should be no license issues with the project with
the OpenStack setup.py file being in use, as neither license are
incompatible with each other.

Change-Id: I0d334e624afe62a53b3324ee45ca9bc454ae1d4a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix license in setup.py

While the ldappool project is MPL and the license info is appropriately
associated with Tarek, setup.py is actually not a file written by him -
it is an exact copy of the boilerplate OpenStack setup.py file which is
Apache licensed. There should be no license issues with the project with
the OpenStack setup.py file being in use, as neither license are
incompatible with each other.

Change-Id: I0d334e624afe62a53b3324ee45ca9bc454ae1d4a

subject: Pass optional timeout to service commands
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 15:24:20.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/common/operating_system.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/service.py'], 'message': 'Pass optional timeout to service commands

Service commands may take some time to return.
The current code does not pass any timeout value into the execute
function resulting in the default 30s value being used.
That value turns out to be too short for certain datastores
(Cassandra) on slower/heavily-loaded systems.

Trove already has a timeout (default=3min) for instance state changes that
should be used instead (this timeout has already been used when
polling for database states).

The service command execute function have been updated to accept an
optional timeout kwargs (like the shell command execute function).
The state change timeout is now being passed in from DB
start/stop/restart calls.

Change-Id: I1ef45b95d9238a52a26f630961657755216786cb
Closes-Bug: 1556314
(cherry picked from commit 87658dc4cc59f7c87d5631fbd6132b98384d396c)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass optional timeout to service commands

Service commands may take some time to return.
The current code does not pass any timeout value into the execute
function resulting in the default 30s value being used.
That value turns out to be too short for certain datastores
(Cassandra) on slower/heavily-loaded systems.

Trove already has a timeout (default=3min) for instance state changes that
should be used instead (this timeout has already been used when
polling for database states).

The service command execute function have been updated to accept an
optional timeout kwargs (like the shell command execute function).
The state change timeout is now being passed in from DB
start/stop/restart calls.

Change-Id: I1ef45b95d9238a52a26f630961657755216786cb
Closes-Bug: 1556314
(cherry picked from commit 87658dc4cc59f7c87d5631fbd6132b98384d396c)

commit_message:
Add support for the oslo db_max_retries parameter

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ief8fe19b1b45cf275f35c05e044ebf226b835311
Closes-Bug: 1579718

subject: Stop complaining about auditor_status files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 03:14:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py'], 'message': "Stop complaining about auditor_status files

Following fd86d5a, the object-auditor would leave status files so it
could resume where it left off if restarted. However, this would also
cause the object-reconstructor to print warnings like:

  Unexpected entity in data dir: u'/srv/node4/sdb8/objects/auditor_status_ZBF.json'

...which isn't actually terribly useful or actionable. The auditor will
clean it up (eventually); the operator doesn't have to do anything.

Now, the reconstructor will specifically ignore those status files.

Change-Id: I2f3d0bd2f1e242db6eb263c7755f1363d1430048
"}]
commit_message:
Stop complaining about auditor_status files

Following fd86d5a, the object-auditor would leave status files so it
could resume where it left off if restarted. However, this would also
cause the object-reconstructor to print warnings like:

  Unexpected entity in data dir: u'/srv/node4/sdb8/objects/auditor_status_ZBF.json'

...which isn't actually terribly useful or actionable. The auditor will
clean it up (eventually); the operator doesn't have to do anything.

Now, the reconstructor will specifically ignore those status files.

Change-Id: I2f3d0bd2f1e242db6eb263c7755f1363d1430048

commit_message:
Increase default OS_TEST_TIMEOUT to 1200

Both build and terminate instance timeout are set to 600sec
for baremetal instances. As result maximum legimate time is 1200
if do not take info account power/state change and other timeouts.
The job timeout is set to 180 minutes [0] so tempest test timeout
value can be safely increased to 1200sec.

Closes-Bug: #1576100
Change-Id: I5343486fa7f4bc7007d8cabd906ef1a136e76e8c

commit_message:
Fix vol type/spec uuid warnings in api.contrib

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the volume type, extra
spec, and encryption unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: Ie502a20cf54bd1d500b15e4ef1ac0c6d64d4cf3f

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-12 08:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py'], 'message': 'Return 4xx error for invalid KMIP key spec.

Currently when using KMIP backend, generating RSA using orders
interface with passphrase returns 500 error. Changed the exception
handling to return 4xx error code [Bad Request]. Also changed
bad algorithm exception. Updated unit test case.

Change-Id: I95204f8e48d2d3208515e8e8ddfbe84dc01c59f3
Closes-Bug: #1568119
'}]
commit_message:
Return 4xx error for invalid KMIP key spec.

Currently when using KMIP backend, generating RSA using orders
interface with passphrase returns 500 error. Changed the exception
handling to return 4xx error code [Bad Request]. Also changed
bad algorithm exception. Updated unit test case.

Change-Id: I95204f8e48d2d3208515e8e8ddfbe84dc01c59f3
Closes-Bug: #1568119

commit_message:
Adding gnocchi client and keystoneauth to rally

Adding gnocchi client and verifying it by unit test case and also registering
gnocchi service to rally. Replacing "default" configuration with None for
project_domain_name and user_domain_name to make it compatible with
keystoneauth1 v2.0 and v3. Also adding gnocchicclient and keystonauth1 to
requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ie9a30297590f4447e39ecd44297e6d216899ef89

subject: Fix issue with importing packages with enabled Glare
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-11 14:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/murano_application/murano.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/murano_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/murano.rb'], 'message': "Fix issue with importing packages with enabled Glare

Current provider is only work with standard storing packages in
murano database (package_service=murano by default) and doesn't
handling parameter package_service in get_murano_credentials function.
In situation when this parameter changed (for example to 'glance')
we can import murano package properly.

Also fix wrong regexp on checking existing packages.

Change-Id: I7c8d207d278bf6ce6cddbb9e1448303bf1f88eb6
Closes-bug: #1572787
Related-bug: #1572785
(cherry picked from commit b36421130e4afcc55ff84c5bcf5d23ba07e2b361)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with importing packages with enabled Glare

Current provider is only work with standard storing packages in
murano database (package_service=murano by default) and doesn't
handling parameter package_service in get_murano_credentials function.
In situation when this parameter changed (for example to 'glance')
we can import murano package properly.

Also fix wrong regexp on checking existing packages.

Change-Id: I7c8d207d278bf6ce6cddbb9e1448303bf1f88eb6
Closes-bug: #1572787
Related-bug: #1572785
(cherry picked from commit b36421130e4afcc55ff84c5bcf5d23ba07e2b361)

The scenario tests need to have the group classes broken

so that the gate can finish in a reasonable amount of time.

The runners, however, need to be the same for each main group,
thus allowing state to be preserved between groups of the same
feature.  The creation of runners was refactored to allow for this.

The module tests were also modified to use the new paradym, which
allowed the removal of the global varaibles in the runner.

Partial-Bug: #1571092
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor scenario tests to facilitate multi-group

The scenario tests need to have the group classes broken
up to allow interleaving of the different parts of the tests
so that the gate can finish in a reasonable amount of time.

The runners, however, need to be the same for each main group,
thus allowing state to be preserved between groups of the same
feature.  The creation of runners was refactored to allow for this.

The module tests were also modified to use the new paradym, which
allowed the removal of the global varaibles in the runner.

Dependencies on tests.api were also removed.

Change-Id: I66fcb2bce8c6cbc99c9ff071c242e4741500056d
Partial-Bug: #1571092

commit_message:
Add 'redis' as a valid service candidate

Currently the only registered service candidate for redis is:
SERVICE_CANDIDATES = ['redis-server']

This should also include the RPM systemd candidate 'redis'.
SERVICE_CANDIDATES = ['redis-server', 'redis']

This change adds 'redis' to the list in SERVICE_CANDIDATES
for systemd redis packages.

Change-Id: Iebefc54be4e7f77941f750bbecf6205c15ca253e
Closes-Bug: #1577819

subject: work around ansible issue #15744
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 19:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['ansible.cfg'], 'message': "work around ansible issue #15744

with Gabriele's upcoming patches that allow the quickstart to run
without performing teardown operations, we hit Ansible issue 15744
(https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15744), in which Ansible
will incorrectly assume it has gathered facts for a host if it *skips*
a play that would otherwise target that host.

This commit removes `gathering=smart` from our ansible.cfg.  We can
restore that configuration if we pin Ansible to 2.1 or later at some
point in the future.

Change-Id: Idda5289a6ea4c724ad2e936b6feb1128925d0e6f
"}]
commit_message:
work around ansible issue #15744

with Gabriele's upcoming patches that allow the quickstart to run
without performing teardown operations, we hit Ansible issue 15744
(https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15744), in which Ansible
will incorrectly assume it has gathered facts for a host if it *skips*
a play that would otherwise target that host.

This commit removes `gathering=smart` from our ansible.cfg.  We can
restore that configuration if we pin Ansible to 2.1 or later at some
point in the future.

Change-Id: Idda5289a6ea4c724ad2e936b6feb1128925d0e6f

subject: compute: Retain instance metadata for 'evacuate' on shared storage
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 11:02:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'compute: Retain instance metadata for 'evacuate' on shared storage

When performing instance evacuation (which is essentially "rebuild an
instance elsewhere"), image metadata is not persistent -- this manifests
only when instances are on shared storage.

So, supply the original instance metadata to 'image_meta' parameter,
instead of an empty dict.

Liberty notes (compared to upstream Newton/Mitaka):

  - We get the image metadata from the instance object's
    system_metadata.
  - We're modifying the tests
    'test_rebuild_on_host_with_shared_storage()' and
    'test_on_shared_storage_not_provided_host_with_shared_storage()' to
    exercise the code change.

Closes-Bug: #1562681
Change-Id: Ibea4954c149b9dcb162c5962ab8e9a4f17e51a1d
(cherry picked from commit 82098d06dbaf401966a70c873b8aa97e7eab4b10)
(cherry picked from commit 524d59e8c32e0eb1ef7fc86d989897d52180ab83)'}]
commit_message:
compute: Retain instance metadata for 'evacuate' on shared storage

When performing instance evacuation (which is essentially "rebuild an
instance elsewhere"), image metadata is not persistent -- this manifests
only when instances are on shared storage.

So, supply the original instance metadata to 'image_meta' parameter,
instead of an empty dict.

Liberty notes (compared to upstream Newton/Mitaka):

  - We get the image metadata from the instance object's
    system_metadata.
  - We're modifying the tests
    'test_rebuild_on_host_with_shared_storage()' and
    'test_on_shared_storage_not_provided_host_with_shared_storage()' to
    exercise the code change.

Closes-Bug: #1562681
Change-Id: Ibea4954c149b9dcb162c5962ab8e9a4f17e51a1d
(cherry picked from commit 82098d06dbaf401966a70c873b8aa97e7eab4b10)
(cherry picked from commit 524d59e8c32e0eb1ef7fc86d989897d52180ab83)

This patch moves the assignment abstract base class out of core and into
backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Change-Id: Ie507b61044ad32ecaac26901c1bcd0a0c17bd381

commit_message:
Move the assignment abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the assignment abstract base class out of core and into
backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: Ie507b61044ad32ecaac26901c1bcd0a0c17bd381

commit_message:
Upgrade PyKMIP to 0.5.0

The 0.5.0 release of PyKMIP includes a new PyKMIP server that can be
used as a key manager for testing purposes. This feature is required
for the proposed Barbican KMIP gate check.

Updating global-requirements to this version will allow a gate check
that can test the Barbican KMIP plugin with an actual KMIP server.

Change-Id: Ifda13a84607bb199b794dc24f5dbba0ee8108dbf

commit_message:
Add pifpaf to requirements

This is going to be used by tooz to set-up test daemons for
unit/functional testing.

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, I just wrote it.

Is the library good code?

Yes, I just wrote it.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, I told you I just wrote it.

Is the library license compatible?

Obviously.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

No, since I just wrote it.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No, or I would not have written it.

Change-Id: Id3e6b694bb186724517599cd9875ad80ceeee053

commit_message:
Add 'force' param for DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks

DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks is intended to run only specified set of
tasks on specified nodes. In Fuel 9.0 LCM serializers have been
introduced, hence tasks are skipped if their condition return 'False'
(and it does, since no changes may introduced).

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular
task on nodes and do not care if there were changes or not. That's why
this commit introduces the '?force' HTTP parameter for the mentioned
handler. If 'force' is true, the task will be executed unconditionally.

(cherry picked from 1f3bd90500202cf436f9640194e1d5e3587b3de4)

Change-Id: Icbaa2bd72c5ff2fc128a0dab4b22d6db77dd36fb
Closes-Bug: #1578974

subject: Fix _get_l2_gateway call
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-18 20:15:31.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/tests/unit/db/test_l2gw_db.py', 'networking_l2gw/db/l2gateway/l2gateway_db.py'], 'message': "Fix _get_l2_gateway call

If an invalid L2 gateway UUID is passed to _get_l2_gateway method,
it returns None instead of raising L2GatewayNotFound exception.
This leads to an Internal Server Error.

This patch replaces the 'try...except' block with an 'if' statement
because get method of SQLAlchemy Query object returns a None
instead of raising NotFound exception.

Closes-Bug: #1570146
Change-Id: Ib95fdaa4af613800159d89960b8b98c839508eaf
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _get_l2_gateway call

If an invalid L2 gateway UUID is passed to _get_l2_gateway method,
it returns None instead of raising L2GatewayNotFound exception.
This leads to an Internal Server Error.

This patch replaces the 'try...except' block with an 'if' statement
because get method of SQLAlchemy Query object returns a None
instead of raising NotFound exception.

Closes-Bug: #1570146
Change-Id: Ib95fdaa4af613800159d89960b8b98c839508eaf

The redstack script used to properly configure validation-rules if
they were available but devstack never did that. When the plugin was
created, it didn't do it either.

In testing the fix for this, it became apparent that the code for
configuring guest images was never workable; the TOKEN variable was
never really initialized.

Closes-Bug: #1448130
Closes-Bug: #1514951
"}]
commit_message:
Correct some issues with devstack plugin for trove

The redstack script used to properly configure validation-rules if
they were available but devstack never did that. When the plugin was
created, it didn't do it either.

In testing the fix for this, it became apparent that the code for
configuring guest images was never workable; the TOKEN variable was
never really initialized.

Both issues have been addressed.

Change-Id: I6665720831337fba644a30f3ee0d5ccb77ef1e4a
Closes-Bug: #1448130
Closes-Bug: #1514951

commit_message:
Change "libvirt.xml" back to the original after doing unrescue

After doing rescue and unrescue "libvirt.xml" is not changed
back to the original.
This patch write back "libvirt.xml" using xml info stored
in "unrescue.xml"

Change-Id: I524ff57d7f21a1b5ecd20ab9b0e377ad9f7e04b9
Closes-Bug: #1558877
(cherry picked from commit 2e39d6444aa4c231da96b4d6314519578dd3dbf2)

subject: Don't delete misplaced dbs if not replicated
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14867, 'name': 'Jaivish Kothari(janonymous)', 'email': 'janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com', 'username': 'Janonymous'}, {'_account_id': 18015, 'name': 'Peter Lisák', 'email': 'peter.lisak@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter.lisak'}, {'_account_id': 20508, 'name': 'Mohit Motiani', 'email': 'mohit.motiani@intel.com', 'username': 'mohit.motiani'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-12 07:28:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py'], 'message': "Don't delete misplaced dbs if not replicated

If one uses only a single replica and a database file is placed on a
wrong partition, it will be removed instead of replicated to the correct
partition.

There are two reasons for this:
1. The list of nodes is empty when there is only a single replica
2. all(responses) is True even if there is no response at all, and the
latter is always True if there is no node to replicate to.

This patch fixes this by adding a special case if used with only one
replica to the node selection loop and ensures that the list of
responses is not empty.  Also adds a test that fails on current master
and passes with this change.

Closes-Bug: 1568591

Change-Id: I028ea8c1928e8c9a401db31fb266ff82606f8371
"}]
commit_message:
Don't delete misplaced dbs if not replicated

If one uses only a single replica and a database file is placed on a
wrong partition, it will be removed instead of replicated to the correct
partition.

There are two reasons for this:
1. The list of nodes is empty when there is only a single replica
2. all(responses) is True even if there is no response at all, and the
latter is always True if there is no node to replicate to.

This patch fixes this by adding a special case if used with only one
replica to the node selection loop and ensures that the list of
responses is not empty.  Also adds a test that fails on current master
and passes with this change.

Closes-Bug: 1568591

Change-Id: I028ea8c1928e8c9a401db31fb266ff82606f8371

commit_message:
libvirt: release serial console ports when destroying guests

The part of code responsible to release serial ports does not cover
all the cases. This commit moves that part inside the method _destroy
which is responsible for destroying the guest from a libvirt
perspective which is when we want to release ports.

Change-Id: I24f2a1fa3b7ef3f2a3196f3689e5f2ba7d49bd87
Closes-Bug: #1489853

The OpenStack Keystone Team (a subset) is adopting the ldappool code

python-3 enable the library. I have discussed this with the original

Change-Id: Id75d304b3e4af98e64d97db29a3aa6c3ca55354e
'}]
commit_message:
Import ldappool into gerrit and setup project

The OpenStack Keystone Team (a subset) is adopting the ldappool code
base from the original author so that we can update/maintain and
python-3 enable the library. I have discussed this with the original
owner and the project is currently unmaintained and we are welcome
to bring it in (since Keystone relies on it).

Change-Id: Id75d304b3e4af98e64d97db29a3aa6c3ca55354e

commit_message:
Renamed murano dashboard panel

Changed the default dashboard name and configuration - the default
dashboard name is now 'Applications'.
The "Application Catalog" panel group was renamed to just "Catalog",
while its inner panel (previously called 'Applications') is now called
'Browse`.

UI tests altered to reflect the changes.

Change-Id: I49999d702f403d946084c5c4312d367404127b47

Add cross-project meeting information

Some initiatives may only involve some projects under the big tent.

in front of a larger audience. This describes how to start those
meetings.

commit_message:
Searchlight Dashboard

Move the searchlight-ui from Project->Search to Search->Search.

Also, modules and directories have been given a consistent structure,
and filters and directives a consistent "sl" prefix.

Implements: blueprint search-dashboard
Change-Id: Iecdcf9c12630ebccceabf9f67828df5176f44c94

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-11 20:41:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Test inventory backup file creation

In addition to adding test cases for creating the inventory backup, this
patch modifies the `get_inventory` function to make the cleanup action
optional. This was done to facilitate the tests, since they required
that clean up not happen in order to verify the relevant scenarios.

Change-Id: I3ec317bc9dc7d950dec726789c16b5434981c796
'}]
commit_message:
Test inventory backup file creation

In addition to adding test cases for creating the inventory backup, this
patch modifies the `get_inventory` function to make the cleanup action
optional. This was done to facilitate the tests, since they required
that clean up not happen in order to verify the relevant scenarios.

Change-Id: I3ec317bc9dc7d950dec726789c16b5434981c796

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-11 15:13:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Test and refactor argument parsing

This patch does not change functionality of the argument parsing
function, but does make it easier to test. While argparse has its own
tests within the standard library and the `args` function could
theoretically be excluded, including these simple tests provide the
coverage we need without introducing the possibility of skipping over
code that might be added later.

Change-Id: I8ee11480ca6e46748fe19fcc19b92aded8a39c39
'}]
commit_message:
Test and refactor argument parsing

This patch does not change functionality of the argument parsing
function, but does make it easier to test. While argparse has its own
tests within the standard library and the `args` function could
theoretically be excluded, including these simple tests provide the
coverage we need without introducing the possibility of skipping over
code that might be added later.

Change-Id: I8ee11480ca6e46748fe19fcc19b92aded8a39c39

subject: Remove voting gate v3 only job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 15:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove voting gate v3 only job

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

Change-Id: Id2f9cca1a9d0b7394f9c3d6e75fed097a72fc94e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove voting gate v3 only job

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

Change-Id: Id2f9cca1a9d0b7394f9c3d6e75fed097a72fc94e

subject: Revert "Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 15:35:26.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting"

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

This reverts commit aed321fae933b6b59153fef80068343d3b60cbb5.

Change-Id: I0c1e0520ee1a1234d7fbea98e2e04d3c29885610
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting"

This job was set as a voting gate job on only devstack and tempest.
However, there was no equivalent coverage in check (there was only a
nv v3 only job) Additionally, there were no other projects with a
voting v3 only job. This commit removes this as it's clearly not
something we should be gating on and leaves us open to wedging either
tempest or devstack with a change in one of the projects.

This reverts commit aed321fae933b6b59153fef80068343d3b60cbb5.

Change-Id: I0c1e0520ee1a1234d7fbea98e2e04d3c29885610

subject: Raise an exception for domains already registered
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 14:05:01.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbmc/tests/unit/test_manager.py', 'virtualbmc/manager.py', 'virtualbmc/exception.py'], 'message': 'Raise an exception for domains already registered

This patch is replacing a sys.exit() in the VirtualBMCManager.add()
method with an exception, the manager class should never use the exit
syscall.

Change-Id: I49bb4107e57ce11a851203a04f48621a6f5439b7
'}]
commit_message:
Raise an exception for domains already registered

This patch is replacing a sys.exit() in the VirtualBMCManager.add()
method with an exception, the manager class should never use the exit
syscall.

Change-Id: I49bb4107e57ce11a851203a04f48621a6f5439b7

commit_message:
Remove use of is_temporary() in resource cleanup

Remove use of is_temporary() defined in keystone scenario
utils in resource cleanup. Instead call name_matches_object()
directly from rally.common.utils.

Change-Id: Ie2dfb5c602f14e022f8cde20df2aeaf572ce0eb7

The public and private network can now be customized using Ansible

 * tempest_private_network_provider_physical_network
 * tempest_private_network_provider_segmentation_id

commit_message:
Provide configurability of networks created for Tempest testing

The public and private network can now be customized using Ansible
variables:
 * tempest_private_network_provider_network_type
 * tempest_private_network_provider_physical_network
 * tempest_private_network_provider_segmentation_id
 * tempest_public_network_provider_network_type
 * tempest_public_network_provider_physical_network

Closes-Bug: #1580292
Change-Id: I13fe502165bc74d00b00033009d84d41a8cbf6f0

commit_message:
Failed migration shoudn't be reported as in progress

This fix add 'failed' status to the list of filters for migrations that are
reported by migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node.

Change-Id: I7de143d73a84339d2184d09e5907cbbe941a2e66
Closes-Bug: #1543123
(cherry picked from commit 0f8f854c2646e2e6677efdf8b1bbf82faf57f01f)

subject: Don't track migrations in 'accepted' state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 10:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Don't track migrations in 'accepted' state

This state was added during Liberty for evacuate, and since it's the
first state that is assigned to the migration record on it's creation,
and before we start using it for resource tracking, there is no reason
to consider those records as "in progress".

Change-Id: I2a9bbe87bc1518cee9e43e4eeec1fa585305f423
Related-bug: 1417667
(cherry picked from commit 2c1f8e6002850a38c82739839be7245b786c9c0c)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't track migrations in 'accepted' state

This state was added during Liberty for evacuate, and since it's the
first state that is assigned to the migration record on it's creation,
and before we start using it for resource tracking, there is no reason
to consider those records as "in progress".

Change-Id: I2a9bbe87bc1518cee9e43e4eeec1fa585305f423
Related-bug: 1417667
(cherry picked from commit 2c1f8e6002850a38c82739839be7245b786c9c0c)

Change-Id: I464c83beb498453b6df2237e7b8022d47ca3fa14
'}]
commit_message:
Implements configurable connection factory

new - create new connection each times
single - use single connection for whole transport
read_write - use two connections for whole transport
                    (one for listening and one for sending)

Change-Id: I464c83beb498453b6df2237e7b8022d47ca3fa14

commit_message:
Fix qos_manage uuid warnings in api.contrib tests

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the qos_manage unit tests
under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib, cleaning up FutureWarnings
from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: Ibc17282732521e6c51e314e3d9e9f0fad80a2fd6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-31 14:19:33.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting

Keystone team decided to deprecate API v2.0 on Mitaka,
since the API v3 it's now the stable API version, this
patch change the devstack gate to be voting.

This patch is part of the plan on this etherpad:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/v3-only-devstack

Besided that, we investigate a couple of issues related to this point
and in a few points, we need to work on:

* Lack of "v3 only" jobs on gates (job on Tempest and Devstack be
  voting, create other service v3 only jobs)
* V3 only devstack fails in some projects like Ironic;
* Lack of keystoneauth session usage in some service clients;
* Delete the Hardcoded v2.0 usage like using v2 url, tenant variables;
* Remove the Keystone CLI usage, like in Nova gate;
* Change v2.0 service tokens to be v3: Hardwritten, automated tools
* OpenStack Client Config
* Add v3 operations tests in Tempest

Change-Id: I3fcc09475b8e76d2a7d95934ba45c6b3a6c4546e
'}]
commit_message:
Changing gate on devstack identity v3 only voting

Keystone team decided to deprecate API v2.0 on Mitaka,
since the API v3 it's now the stable API version, this
patch change the devstack gate to be voting.

This patch is part of the plan on this etherpad:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/v3-only-devstack

Besided that, we investigate a couple of issues related to this point
and in a few points, we need to work on:

* Lack of "v3 only" jobs on gates (job on Tempest and Devstack be
  voting, create other service v3 only jobs)
* V3 only devstack fails in some projects like Ironic;
* Lack of keystoneauth session usage in some service clients;
* Delete the Hardcoded v2.0 usage like using v2 url, tenant variables;
* Remove the Keystone CLI usage, like in Nova gate;
* Change v2.0 service tokens to be v3: Hardwritten, automated tools
* OpenStack Client Config
* Add v3 operations tests in Tempest

Change-Id: I3fcc09475b8e76d2a7d95934ba45c6b3a6c4546e

subject: Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-21 16:05:24.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-mysql-replication-bf2b131994a5a772.yaml', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/mysql_gtid.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/replication_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/replication_runners.py'], 'message': "Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

A release note has been added.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication
because it mechanism is different.

Scenario tests were run succesfully on Mysql, Percona and
MariaDB with this change in place.

Change-Id: I66c8b6278afa50ba14e4bb7888e3a25dc657a9e4
Closes-bug: 1563574
"}]
commit_message:
Mysql GTID replication fails when data inserted

If you have a master and a slave configured and you insert
new data into the master, it will cause subsequent replica
create to fail.

The problem is that we weren't setting the gtid_purged variable
using the metadata in the xtrabackup_binlog_info file. The
Mysql GTID replication strategy was adjusted to account for this.

A release note has been added.

The replication scenario tests were enhanced to validate this
issue.

Note: this issue doesn't occur with MariaDB GTID replication
because it mechanism is different.

Scenario tests were run succesfully on Mysql, Percona and
MariaDB with this change in place.

Change-Id: I66c8b6278afa50ba14e4bb7888e3a25dc657a9e4
Closes-bug: 1563574

endpoint_override when doing _http_request in SessionClient.
This change fixes it.

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-04-20 12:54:46.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/ssh_remote.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/utils/test_ssh_remote.py'], 'message': "Helper method to use dnf instead of yum on fedora >=22

There are multiple places where packages may be installed
at cluster launch time or even during the run of an EDP
job (for instance on-demand manila share mounting).

Fedora is transitioning from use of 'yum' to 'dnf'.
While yum is still available in F22 and F23, it has
been deprecated and ultimately will be replaced with dnf.

This helper method will process said install commands using dnf
on yum 22 and above and yum otherwise.

Based on feedback, replacing the new method by modifying the
one in ssh_remote instead.
Change-Id: If0f0356710293da16e047481166991a0287d6f17
Closes-Bug:1561153
"}]
commit_message:
Helper method to use dnf instead of yum on fedora >=22

There are multiple places where packages may be installed
at cluster launch time or even during the run of an EDP
job (for instance on-demand manila share mounting).

Fedora is transitioning from use of 'yum' to 'dnf'.
While yum is still available in F22 and F23, it has
been deprecated and ultimately will be replaced with dnf.

This helper method will process said install commands using dnf
on yum 22 and above and yum otherwise.

Based on feedback, replacing the new method by modifying the
one in ssh_remote instead.
Change-Id: If0f0356710293da16e047481166991a0287d6f17
Closes-Bug:1561153

Now, freezer-agent backup nova to swift by default.
but more and more demand  backup it to the specified directory.

restore nova usage:

--container /home/nfs

commit_message:
Backup nova to local

Now, freezer-agent backup nova to swift by default.
but more and more demand  backup it to the specified directory.
This patch fix it backup it to local.

backup nova usage:
freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--storage local --container /home/nfs

restore nova usage:

freezer-agent --nova-inst-id 1983bb28-b962-4597-ab83-c7529594c1c5
--restore-from-date 2016-04-28T09:55:50 --storage local
--container /home/nfs

Closes-Bug: #1576008
Implements blueprint: backup-nova-cinder-to-non-swift

Change-Id: I81a0c12207f4f52d97857e852ba18c7dfe92bc48

commit_message:
Mark additional tasks info column as deferred

Fields:

- deployment_info;
- cluster_settings;
- network_settings.

in sum take 150Mb for cluster with 200 nodes. Every task
request will create heavy db select, so it will take
a lot of memory, cpu load and dramatically decrease
receiver performance.

With this change this fields will be loaded only if
Nailgun directly required them.

Change-Id: I2417b0370914a0bd3a7f92e897826d9d86e76773
Closes-Bug: #1570509

when this variable is not set, file_line will treate it as 'present'

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 10:07:34.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/unit/v1/test_nodes_execute_tasks.py', 'fuelclient/objects/environment.py', 'fuelclient/cli/actions/node.py', 'fuelclient/objects/node.py'], 'message': "Add 'force' param for DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks

DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks is intended to run only specified set of
tasks on specified nodes. In Fuel 9.0 LCM serializers have been
introduced, hence tasks are skipped if their condition return 'False'
(and it does, since no changes may introduced).

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular
task on nodes and do not care if there were changes or not. That's why
this commit introduces the '?force' HTTP parameter for the mentioned

Change-Id: Iaf005341468a4e35cd82586ba3f7b585fdf4752c

commit_message:
Add 'force' param for DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks

DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks is intended to run only specified set of
tasks on specified nodes. In Fuel 9.0 LCM serializers have been
introduced, hence tasks are skipped if their condition return 'False'
(and it does, since no changes may introduced).

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular
task on nodes and do not care if there were changes or not. That's why
this commit introduces the '?force' HTTP parameter for the mentioned
handler. If 'force' is true, the task will be executed unconditionally.

Closes-Bug: #1578974

Depends-On: Icbaa2bd72c5ff2fc128a0dab4b22d6db77dd36fb
Change-Id: Iaf005341468a4e35cd82586ba3f7b585fdf4752c

subject: [WIP] Get rid of boot partitions on "raid"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9377, 'name': 'Sergey Slipushenko', 'email': 'slipushenko@gmail.com', 'username': 'sslypushenko'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 00:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/tests/test_pipelines.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/tests/test_node_disks.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Get rid of boot partitions on "raid"

Current partitioning schema contains at least 3 partitions per disk.
These partitions are used only on bootable disk. So, if we have, for
example, node with 64 disks, this node has 189 useless partitions.

With this patch nailgun only reserve 0.5Gb of space on each disk and
let the fuel-agent decide, what required boot partions should be
created.

Change-Id: I9a656dc516f70ffbf9fc5d73d078ca697063a364
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Get rid of boot partitions on "raid"

Current partitioning schema contains at least 3 partitions per disk.
These partitions are used only on bootable disk. So, if we have, for
example, node with 64 disks, this node has 189 useless partitions.

With this patch nailgun only reserve 0.5Gb of space on each disk and
let the fuel-agent decide, what required boot partions should be
created.

Change-Id: I9a656dc516f70ffbf9fc5d73d078ca697063a364

commit_message:
Fix for address allocation respecting existing libvirt networks

listDefinedNetworks() show only stopped networks, skipping 'active'
networks.
To get all libvirt networks, let's use listAllNetworks()

Change-Id: Id86496af007dbb28ce78bfd239b30fba36cc39cf

commit_message:
Allow freezer to use trickle installed system wide

Freezer is using trickle only if it's installed system wide and not
looking for trickle-overload.so library anymore. Users have to
install trickle: apt-get install trickle or yum install trickle
for freezer to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1553159
(cherry picked from commit de0344b4c845e6d0bd5c8961648a809e84bf6d93)

Conflicts:
	README.rst
Change-Id: I49efff29876990dfd0782e3cf5ad68daf3e6055d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-04 21:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/cells-mq-connection-switching.rst'], 'message': 'Message queue connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to send RPC messages to cells, the message queue
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell message queue information to the RPC API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-mq-connection-switching

Change-Id: Id9b73264dbc9eb4d6d652dbed7997ceae1364d7e
'}]
commit_message:
Message queue connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to send RPC messages to cells, the message queue
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell message queue information to the RPC API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-mq-connection-switching

Change-Id: Id9b73264dbc9eb4d6d652dbed7997ceae1364d7e

commit_message:
The need to wait for a given time is no longer valid in 3.2+

The condition interrupt but is fixed in 3.2 so we can avoid
some of the legacy logic in that version (and eventually at
some point we can just remove that code).

Change-Id: I45a871a212bb06fb69c36405161a9e66601b0f0d

subject: crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-22 15:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/saio/swift/proxy-server.conf', 'swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes.py', 'swift/common/middleware/server_side_copy.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'doc/source/logs.rst', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_server_side_copy.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_sysmeta.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_constraints.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'doc/source/middleware.rst', 'doc/source/overview_server_side_copy.rst', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/common/middleware/dlo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_versioned_writes.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'setup.cfg', 'test/unit/common/middleware/helpers.py'], 'message': "crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware

Rewrite server side copy and 'object post as copy' feature as middleware to
simplify the PUT method in the object controller code. COPY is no longer
a verb implemented as public method in Proxy application.

The server side copy middleware is inserted to the left of dlo, slo and
versioned_writes middlewares in the proxy server pipeline. As a result,
dlo and slo copy_hooks are no longer required. SLO manifests are now
validated when copied so when copying a manifest to another account the
referenced segments must be readable in that account for the manifest
copy to succeed (previously this validation was not made, meaning the
manifest was copied but could be unusable if the segments were not
readable).

With this change, there should be no change in functionality or existing
behavior. This is asserted with (almost) no changes required to existing
functional tests.

Some notes (for operators):
* Middleware required to be auto-inserted before slo and dlo and
  versioned_writes
* Turning off server side copy is not configurable.
* object_post_as_copy is no longer a configurable option of proxy server
  but of this middleware. However, for smooth upgrade, config option set
  in proxy server app is also read.

DocImpact: Introducing server side copy as middleware

Change-Id: I538c3b1cea75975df99c41dcc4094c1e764cb994
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
crypto - Refactor server side copy as middleware

Rewrite server side copy and 'object post as copy' feature as middleware to
simplify the PUT method in the object controller code. COPY is no longer
a verb implemented as public method in Proxy application.

The server side copy middleware is inserted to the left of dlo, slo and
versioned_writes middlewares in the proxy server pipeline. As a result,
dlo and slo copy_hooks are no longer required. SLO manifests are now
validated when copied so when copying a manifest to another account the
referenced segments must be readable in that account for the manifest
copy to succeed (previously this validation was not made, meaning the
manifest was copied but could be unusable if the segments were not
readable).

With this change, there should be no change in functionality or existing
behavior. This is asserted with (almost) no changes required to existing
functional tests.

Some notes (for operators):
* Middleware required to be auto-inserted before slo and dlo and
  versioned_writes
* Turning off server side copy is not configurable.
* object_post_as_copy is no longer a configurable option of proxy server
  but of this middleware. However, for smooth upgrade, config option set
  in proxy server app is also read.

DocImpact: Introducing server side copy as middleware

Change-Id: I538c3b1cea75975df99c41dcc4094c1e764cb994
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

Do not omit syncing the '*-all.log' syslog files

While parsing syslogtag from many sources we always should sync.

commit_message:
Fix CG uuid warnings in api.contrib unit tests

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the consistency group
and cgsnapshot  unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

commit_message:
Add a config for a minimum ttl

This ensures we can specify the minimum ttl to use when creating zones
or recordsets from random ttls, which includes some refactoring to use
a single method for generating ttls.

Change-Id: I5c8620ff5a15b935ba075bec1f9750dbae4ffb70

commit_message:
Move logging outside of LibvirtConfigObject.to_xml

Logging the xml in LibvirtConfigObject doesn't provide
much context. Instead remove the logging from there and
move it to the caller where neccessary.

Log the instance when doing cpu comparison to add context
to the log messages.

Closes-Bug: #1491414
Change-Id: Ie7b9b41de40f10820a2b9e04198464cd2da46e8c

commit_message:
Fix job launching with cluster in any state

Now we can launch job only on clusters that in Active or Error state.
* added 'in {state} state' phrase to cluster selection field for
  clusters that in the state that differs from 'Active' state.
* added warning message for the choice of the cluster in the state
  that differs from 'Active' state.
* added 'No clusters available' message if there are no suitable
  clusters for a job launching.

Change-Id: I949b81290f94370eb0709f0a04e4d2ce39855323
bp: cluster-choice-for-jobs
closes-bug: 1430232

subject: Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 09:03:10.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prepare-containers.yml'], 'message': 'Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost

The test-prepare-containers task runs connection as local, which ends up
running tasks against the local host that are not intended to be run,
for example the initial host's hostname is changed to that of the last
host it sets up. In this case "infra1".

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: Id1aa1ad4ca177a8b60b07d8c9b3834507a3a0606
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost

The test-prepare-containers task runs connection as local, which ends up
running tasks against the local host that are not intended to be run,
for example the initial host's hostname is changed to that of the last
host it sets up. In this case "infra1".

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: Id1aa1ad4ca177a8b60b07d8c9b3834507a3a0606

commit_message:
Prevent erroneous tasks running against localhost

The test-prepare-containers task runs connection as local, which ends up
running tasks against the local host that are not intended to be run,
for example the initial host's hostname is changed to that of the last
host it sets up. In this case "infra1".

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: I4675d41a602ffd7534790e2aca09f6580148423f

So far the requirements update script copies a reference
to Hewlett-Packard Development Company to all projects that are
listed in projects.txt, which every once in a while stirs confusion.
Assigning the copyright to the Foundation should resolve this.

Change-Id: I2b654a5297e91cd5899457204b20cd1eb113ba60
'}]
commit_message:
Use OpenStack Foundation for setup.py copyright

So far the requirements update script copies a reference
to Hewlett-Packard Development Company to all projects that are
listed in projects.txt, which every once in a while stirs confusion.
Assigning the copyright to the Foundation should resolve this.

Change-Id: I2b654a5297e91cd5899457204b20cd1eb113ba60

Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with
use of subprocess module.

Change-Id: I21ce4678879302538239f570150b727375adc47c
Closes-bug: #1529836

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I2baa7b7b21c6d44305fdbb3639898c1ef4c258e3
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I2baa7b7b21c6d44305fdbb3639898c1ef4c258e3
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-09 07:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Revert "Install master's version of an RDO keystone"

This was a temporary workaround because RDO didn't update to
keystone bootstrap command operations.

commit_message:
Stop using git:// and be nice to people behind proxy servers

The build of tinyipa is doing a: git clone git://...

Doing a git clone git://... behind a proxy server is painful. Use the
'official' QEMU github mirror and clone with https.

Change-Id: Ia14835e6867b945cccb8b1987aa4881d8524561c
Closes-Bug: #1578778
(cherry picked from commit 4be5e084080cde8e53dd83e21a4ac9da3a12b6b2)

commit_message:
Fix invalid config serialization for primary- roles

Roles that are passed via parameter to function
inject_configs retrieved from `objects.Node.all_roles`
function. This function adds prefix `primary-` to
generic role names.
In this case configuration, that was created for role
`controller`, won't be executed on `primary-controller`
node, since role `controller` was replaced with
`primary-controller`

Change-Id: Ibba3a1d25079bd7b356e8e65da11c19a8017d4ba
Closes-Bug: #1576127

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 18:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/monitor_metric.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_monitor_metric.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997
(cherry picked from commit ddb3c4e26f3a908de7836a8fac48360afa6aa1d7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong CPU metric value in metrics_filter

CPU metrics are reported as a normalized value in [0,1].
When scheduler reads the data as MonitorMetric object, as part
of update_from_compute_node(), the value of the metric gets
lost due to a wrong type conversion, typecasting into an Integer,
reduces it to 0.

Note:
 - It may seem unintuitive that to fix the same, we are not changing
   the type of metric from Integer to Float. Please refer the
   discussions -
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243825/
   * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216923/
 - To summarize, we are trying to save some 'possible' downstream consumer
   of metrics updates from compute nodes, i.e. consuming from AMPQ, from
   software upgrade scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib504af33e05dfc4d7e97b52682e27befc67d784a
Closes-bug: #1514997
(cherry picked from commit ddb3c4e26f3a908de7836a8fac48360afa6aa1d7)

commit_message:
Fix retry mechanism for generator results

Both v1 and v2 of the glance client return python generators in some
cases (rather than fully fleshed out lists) which thwarts our retry
mechanism. Convert generator results to a list, so that any potential
exceptions get raised earlier rather than later, allowing for retries.

Conflicts:

    /nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py

Conflict notes: I couldn't add the following assert from master because
client.api_servers didn't exist then. It was added in commit
590b2c30073843f736680cdea4d6a6f8c673d725. Instead, I added one that
follows the pattern at that time.

  self.assertEqual(str(client.api_server), "https://host2:9293")

Change-Id: Ibc84f1596d4eaabdef0a48f6cf4da2d1323843a8
Closes-Bug: #1557584
(cherry picked from commit ae6d868e2f13f90d9f97c982fdbbccdc6fb8b9c9)

commit_message:
Apply feature_groups settings in Nailgun

Apply feature_groups settings in Nailgun only during post-deployment
phase (when Fuel master is installed) and only if they were changed.

Change-Id: Ia849153e15f4bd9ab568221374a7f8ef2fb6c52d

commit_message:
Configure LVM filter to only allow cinder device

This patch changes /etc/lvm/lvm.conf to allow only the device used
for cinder and to reject all other devices, as suggested in the
install-guide.

Change-Id: Ia00b2ef3727ba263ea2ce1645b494adc6dd25fef

(cherry picked from commit 904eec20f8bee54f9b620b06779776bb77210461)

commit_message:
Add ssh public key to Fuel master node

This commit adds an ability to use ssh public key authentication for
the Fuel master node by uploading your ssh public key to it. The path
to the public key file can be provided in the 'config.sh' file.

Closes-Bug: #1579123
Change-Id: I93560126940457518fc4385c0518ab00c0cac01a
(cherry picked from commit 904eec20f8bee54f9b620b06779776bb77210461)

subject: Support single-AZ deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-11 13:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/utils.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Support single-AZ deployment

This supports the case where OpenStack is deployed with a single AZ
for both controller(s) and compute(s), and not all hosts in the AZ
that contains an instance are guaranteed to have the nova-compute
service.

Change-Id: If5a8bd0df863b94f3c3e7117df4586dbc56f48bc
'}]
commit_message:
Support single-AZ deployment

This supports the case where OpenStack is deployed with a single AZ
for both controller(s) and compute(s), and not all hosts in the AZ
that contains an instance are guaranteed to have the nova-compute
service.

Change-Id: If5a8bd0df863b94f3c3e7117df4586dbc56f48bc

commit_message:
Fix volume test uuid warnings in api.contrib

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the various
volume unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: I526f9cf1c383f75490f1ac86c0fc5182376f5b3e

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-12 08:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/df_base_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_db_notifier.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_objects.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py', 'dragonflow/tests/common/app_testing_objects.py', 'dragonflow/db/api_nb.py', 'dragonflow/controller/ryu_base_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/sg_app.py'], 'message': 'Security group app support port update event

This patch intend to add security group app the support to port update
events. To doing this, I divided "logical_port_created" event from
"logical_port_updated" event in api_nb.py, added "update_local_port" and
"update_remote_port" notify event type in df_db_notifier.py, and added port
update event process in sg_app.py.

Closes-Bug: 1571523
Change-Id: I38ccb4f3f761a20fd9f269367d3097240d5d9bc7
'}]
commit_message:
Security group app support port update event

This patch intend to add security group app the support to port update
events. To doing this, I divided "logical_port_created" event from
"logical_port_updated" event in api_nb.py, added "update_local_port" and
"update_remote_port" notify event type in df_db_notifier.py, and added port
update event process in sg_app.py.

Closes-Bug: 1571523
Change-Id: I38ccb4f3f761a20fd9f269367d3097240d5d9bc7

commit_message:
compute: Retain instance metadata for 'evacuate' on shared storage

When performing instance evacuation (which is essentially "rebuild an
instance elsewhere"), image metadata is not persistent -- this manifests
only when instances are on shared storage.

So, supply the original instance metadata to 'image_meta' parameter,
instead of an empty dict.

Liberty notes (compared to upstream Newton/Mitaka):

  - We get the image metadata from the instance object's
    system_metadata.
  - We're modifying the tests
    'test_rebuild_on_host_with_shared_storage()' and
    'test_on_shared_storage_not_provided_host_with_shared_storage()' to
    exercise the code change.

Change-Id: Ib127090fba2bfd3411433092ed35a9a5f6902804
Upstream-Newton: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309440/
Upstream-Mitaka: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311990/
Closes-Bug: #1562681

commit_message:
Limit number of metadata workers

metadata_workers option from Nova is not used, so currently a number of
metadata workers on all nodes is equal to number of CPUs.
This patch limits a number of workers using following schemes:
- for controllers: min(max($::processorcount, 2), $workers_max)
- for computes (DVR): min($::processorcount / 8 + 1, $workers_max))

Change-Id: Ifac069347be758ac2c12b890a3b4751db1a12e21
Closes-bug: #1575724
(cherry picked from commit 7394062ec83f5ee32b042af8c04829b9a12e6838)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-06 22:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': "WIP Add update_inventories to ResourceProvider

Take a list of Inventory objects associated with a resource provider
and update, create or delete as necessary. Do it it all in one
transaction.

This involves a few steps:

* get a list of a existing inventories for this provider to compare
  with the incoming list
* get the resources for the provider to have access to current
  'used' information
* merge incoming inventory data into existing inventories so they
  can be save(d)
* inventories that don't yet exist, create()
* existing inventories that don't have incoming inventory,
  destroy()

This has been done on ResourceProvider instead of InventoryList
because access to 'used' information (via
resource_provider.resources) should be in the same transaction
as everything else, lest we race.

Change-Id: I7e7f70ed73c0d53795ebc2bea17a5c0292ede5aa
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Add update_inventories to ResourceProvider

Take a list of Inventory objects associated with a resource provider
and update, create or delete as necessary. Do it it all in one
transaction.

This involves a few steps:

* get a list of a existing inventories for this provider to compare
  with the incoming list
* get the resources for the provider to have access to current
  'used' information
* merge incoming inventory data into existing inventories so they
  can be save(d)
* inventories that don't yet exist, create()
* existing inventories that don't have incoming inventory,
  destroy()

This has been done on ResourceProvider instead of InventoryList
because access to 'used' information (via
resource_provider.resources) should be in the same transaction
as everything else, lest we race.

Change-Id: I7e7f70ed73c0d53795ebc2bea17a5c0292ede5aa

commit_message:
Message in receiverd should be requeued on deadlock

On the deadlock psycopg2 throws TransactionRollbackError.
SQLAlchemy wraps it into OperationalError. We are detecting
that OperationalError reason is deadlock and requeue message
into the RabbitMQ queue.

Change-Id: I12703a268422ad82f3eb92becc8024eef37d7091
Closes-Bug: #1578218

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular

commit_message:
Add 'force' param for DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks

DeploySelectedNodesWithTasks is intended to run only specified set of
tasks on specified nodes. In Fuel 9.0 LCM serializers have been
introduced, hence tasks are skipped if their condition return 'False'
(and it does, since no changes may introduced).

This introduces inconvenience for operators, who want to run particular
task on nodes and do not care if there were changes or not. That's why
this commit introduces the '?force' HTTP parameter for the mentioned
handler. If 'force' is true, the task will be executed unconditionally.

Change-Id: Icbaa2bd72c5ff2fc128a0dab4b22d6db77dd36fb
Closes-Bug: #1578974

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 12:16:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "db: retry instance_info_cache_update() on deadlock

If a Galera cluster is used in multi-writer mode it's possible, that
instance_info_cache_update() will be executed concurrently on two
different MySQL hosts for the very same row, which causes a deadlock
exception for one of the callers due to how Galera works internally.

This can affect operations like association or disassociation of
floating IPs, which will fail, if instance_info_cache_update() does
not handle deadlocks gracefully, i.e. is not retried.

Closes-Bug: #1567336

Change-Id: Ib5abffd94d2480dfbcc8b6cca7b1c73ce39e7d10
"}]
commit_message:
db: retry instance_info_cache_update() on deadlock

If a Galera cluster is used in multi-writer mode it's possible, that
instance_info_cache_update() will be executed concurrently on two
different MySQL hosts for the very same row, which causes a deadlock
exception for one of the callers due to how Galera works internally.

This can affect operations like association or disassociation of
floating IPs, which will fail, if instance_info_cache_update() does
not handle deadlocks gracefully, i.e. is not retried.

Closes-Bug: #1567336

Change-Id: Ib5abffd94d2480dfbcc8b6cca7b1c73ce39e7d10

Currently HA router interface port uses DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF as
device owner(like normal router interface). So to check if a port is
a HA router interface port, we have to perform a DB operation.

Neutron server at many places may need check if a port is HA router
interface port and perform different set of operations, then it has
to access DB for this. Instead of that, if this information is
available as port's device owner, we can avoid DB access every time.

Closes-bug: #1554519
Change-Id: I322c392529c04aca2448fd957a35f4908b323449
"}]
commit_message:
use separate device owner for HA router interface

Currently HA router interface port uses DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF as
device owner(like normal router interface). So to check if a port is
a HA router interface port, we have to perform a DB operation.

Neutron server at many places may need check if a port is HA router
interface port and perform different set of operations, then it has
to access DB for this. Instead of that, if this information is
available as port's device owner, we can avoid DB access every time.

Closes-bug: #1554519
Change-Id: I322c392529c04aca2448fd957a35f4908b323449

commit_message:
Add ssh public key to Fuel master node

This commit adds an ability to use ssh public key authentication for
the Fuel master node by uploading your ssh public key to it. The path
to the public key file can be provided in the 'config.sh' file.

Closes-Bug: #1579123
Change-Id: I93560126940457518fc4385c0518ab00c0cac01a

This commit implements the ability to utilize the
openvswitch ml2 plugin instead of the linuxbrige
plugin.

Primarily, these changes include new/modified
parameters to existing plays and a sizeable
refactoring of variable names and locations within
defaults/main.yml.

By default, installations will continue to utilize
the linuxbridge_agent; to utilize openvswitch_agent,
the following is variable must be specified via user

Implements: blueprint support-openvswitch

Change-Id: Ifdeccb1166944e58a448b4cf08a679a1e67e534d
'}]
commit_message:
Implementing neutron_openvswitch_agent

This commit implements the ability to utilize the
openvswitch ml2 plugin instead of the linuxbrige
plugin.

Primarily, these changes include new/modified
parameters to existing plays and a sizeable
refactoring of variable names and locations within
defaults/main.yml.

By default, installations will continue to utilize
the linuxbridge_agent; to utilize openvswitch_agent,
the following is variable must be specified via user
variable or some other means:
neutron_plugin_type: ml2.ovs

Implements: blueprint support-openvswitch
Depends-On: I971df850c23f4d402f475cc50300f96bee547d46
Change-Id: Ifdeccb1166944e58a448b4cf08a679a1e67e534d

commit_message:

'fuelweb_admin' network in which case cluster relation could not be determined.

Closes-Bug: #1576660

commit_message:
Use task state instead of output to create haproxy log directory

Use the previous tasks changed state to create haproxy log
directories.  Both use the same "log_dir.rc != 0" logic.
This allows the play to run in check mode.

Change-Id: I731ea1ec7822266cd9a433b328e5dc5cdd0a205a

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I6d2db4687632e9be2848c819d2eb93ffe680ba24
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Add tests for redeploy env with unpinned CPUs

This testgroup should be run with this parameters:

export KVM_USE=True
export SLAVE_NODE_CPU=6
export DRIVER_ENABLE_ACPI=true
export NUMA_NODES=2

Change-Id: I3c4ada622efdf8a49926c7c2533de7542231373d
Implements: blueprint test-numa-cpu-pinning
(cherry picked from commit dbf92d90ea1b945e6963905c868aa859aa45b688)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 08:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'migration volume failed for invalid type

Boot an instance from image (create a new volume), then migrate this
volume. When migrating, source_type and destination_type will be
checked for validity. The valid source is volume. But source_type is
not volume, is image in the block_device_mapping table. It causes
migration failure.
In fact, just check destination_type can, do not need to check
source_type.

Change-Id: I0d6819b0b23bde17f0a7bd5e45f89509eb83ebbf
Closes-Bug: #1554859
'}]
commit_message:
migration volume failed for invalid type

Boot an instance from image (create a new volume), then migrate this
volume. When migrating, source_type and destination_type will be
checked for validity. The valid source is volume. But source_type is
not volume, is image in the block_device_mapping table. It causes
migration failure.
In fact, just check destination_type can, do not need to check
source_type.

Change-Id: I0d6819b0b23bde17f0a7bd5e45f89509eb83ebbf
Closes-Bug: #1554859

commit_message:
add ipv6 options to neutron_subnet type

Allows setting the ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode options
to be when an ipv6 subnet is created.

Change-Id: Ie7e6b489f5646ab469594f0ffea859f72b20fd89
(cherry picked from commit 3e3ffdfdd72c6d01417fffd5676175fe094afa3c)

subject: Enhance descriptions for get and clear password
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-11 09:15:00.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "Enhance descriptions for get and clear password

per http://paste.openstack.org/show/495955/
it shows nova get-password and clear-password is calling
'os-server-password' and in turn operate on metadata server

lead to confusion in nova client description.

Change-Id: If69622c181ad3259855d45cb21909e5b7de53615
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance descriptions for get and clear password

per http://paste.openstack.org/show/495955/
it shows nova get-password and clear-password is calling
'os-server-password' and in turn operate on metadata server
instead of the operating systme itself, the existing wording
lead to confusion in nova client description.

Change-Id: If69622c181ad3259855d45cb21909e5b7de53615

The results from the MulticastVerificationTask are created

These lists contain the correct data but are not always in the

commit_message:
Sort result of MulticastVerificationTask in integration test

The results from the MulticastVerificationTask are created
by manipulating sets and then converting the results to a list.
These lists contain the correct data but are not always in the
same order which causes test_multicast_no_messages_for_one_node
to fail.

Change-Id: Ibc716bfb18a93ab98c813af9fc9d14e2150520bc
Closes-bug: #1579223
